items.title: Software: crescita in frenata, ma l’AI può rilanciare una filiera strategica
items.summary:
Il settore software italiano rallenta dopo anni di incremento sostenuto: nel 2024 il fatturato raggiunge 66,7 miliardi (+8,3%) e la stima per il 2025 è di 70,1 miliardi (+5,2%). L’intelligenza artificiale è la tecnologia più diffusa, ma la sua integrazione resta marginale. Senza una strategia industriale stabile, l’Italia rischia di perdere competitività

items.title: IoT forensics: l’analisi forense nell’era dei dispositivi connessi
items.summary: La IoT forensics rappresenta una delle frontiere più complesse della digital forensics moderna. Mentre l'investigazione digitale tradizionale si è consolidata su metodologie ben definite per computer, smartphone e server, l'esplosione dell'Internet of Things ha introdotto sfide senza precedenti: pacemaker che registrano ritmi cardiaci, sistemi industriali SCADA che controllano infrastrutture critiche, automobili connesse che memorizzano gigabyte...

Con un mercato globale che ha raggiunto i 9,76 miliardi di dollari nel 2024 secondo Market Data Forecast, e una crescita prevista del 12,2% annuo fino al 2029, questo approccio standardizzato dal NIST e...

items.title: Cloud forensics: acquisizione delle prove in ambienti multi-tenant e chain of custody nei cloud ibridi
items.summary: La migrazione massiva verso architetture cloud ha ridefinito completamente i paradigmi dell'informatica forense. Secondo il rapporto Q2 2025 di Coveware by Veeam, il pagamento medio per attacco ransomware ha raggiunto 1,13 milioni di dollari, un incremento del 104%...

Il micromanagement burocratico non crea un clima d’investimento favorevole alle imprese – il valore aggiunto...

items.title: Il ransomware gestito da operatori umani: analisi tecnica delle minacce, impatti e strategie di difesa nell’era moderna
items.summary: Il ransomware gestito da operatori umani rappresenta una trasformazione fondamentale nel panorama delle minacce cyber, evolvendo da attacchi automatizzati di massa a operazioni sofisticate condotte da criminali altamente qualificati. A differenza del ransomware automatico che si propaga indiscriminatamente attraverso vulnerabilità note, gli attacchi human-operated coinvolgono avversari attivi che conducono ricognizione estensiva, adattano le loro tattiche...

items.author: Robert Booth UK technology editor

items.title: What AI doesn’t know: we could be creating a global ‘knowledge collapse’ | Deepak Varuvel Dennison
items.summary:
As GenAI becomes the primary way to find information, local and traditional wisdom is being lost. And we are only beginning to realise what we’re missing

items.title: Buckingham Palace Christmas market: why tourists flocked there – and found just locked gates and big puddles
items.summary: The hot spot seemed the perfect place for Yuletide-loving royalists. But, as with the Eiffel Tower in Beijing and some of the most picturesque windmills in the Netherlands, there was much less to it than first met the eye ...Name: Buckingham Palace Christmas market.Age: Brand new this year.

items.title: Scaling innovation in manufacturing with AI
items.summary: Manufacturing is getting a major system upgrade. As AI amplifies existing technologies—like digital twins, the cloud, edge computing, and the industrial internet of things (IIoT)—it is enabling factory operations teams to shift from reactive, isolated problem-solving to proactive, systemwide optimization. Digital twins—physically accurate virtual representations of a piece of equipment, a production line, a process,…

items.title: Quantum physicists have shrunk and “de-censored” DeepSeek R1
items.summary: A group of quantum physicists claims to have created a version of the powerful reasoning AI model DeepSeek R1 that strips out the censorship built into the original by its Chinese creators.  The scientists at Multiverse Computing, a Spanish firm specializing in quantum-inspired AI techniques, created DeepSeek R1 Slim, a model that is 55% smaller…

items.title: Hackers Actively Exploiting 7-Zip Symbolic Link–Based RCE Vulnerability (CVE-2025-11001)
items.summary:
A recently disclosed security flaw impacting 7-Zip has come under active exploitation in the wild, according to an advisory issued by the U.K. NHS England Digital on Tuesday.
The vulnerability in question is CVE-2025-11001 (CVSS score: 7.0), which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code. It has been addressed in 7-Zip version 25.00 released in July 2025.

items.author: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

items.title: Python-Based WhatsApp Worm Spreads Eternidade Stealer Across Brazilian Devices
items.summary:
Cybersecurity researchers have disclosed details of a new campaign that leverages a combination of social engineering and WhatsApp hijacking to distribute a Delphi-based banking trojan named Eternidade Stealer as part of attacks targeting users in Brazil.

items.author: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)

items.title: WrtHug Exploits Six ASUS WRT Flaws to Hijack Tens of Thousands of EoL Routers Worldwide
items.summary:
A newly discovered campaign has compromised tens of thousands of outdated or end-of-life (EoL) ASUS routers worldwide, predominantly in Taiwan, the U.S., and Russia, to rope them into a massive network.
The router hijacking activity has been codenamed Operation WrtHug by SecurityScorecard's STRIKE team. Southeast Asia and European countries are some of the other regions where infections have
